snippet: The measures announced by President Obama include a push to give ex-prisoners greater leeway to apply for jobs and housing without disclosing their criminal records.
abstract: Pres Obama orders federal agencies to stop asking about personal criminal history on job applications, and to delay such inquiries until later in interview process; also unveils series of small initiatives intended to make it easier for former prisoners to find jobs and live in subsidized housing.
lead_paragraph: The measures announced by President Obama include a push to give ex-prisoners greater leeway to apply for jobs and housing without disclosing their criminal records.

headline.main: Obama Takes Steps to Help Former Inmates Find Jobs and Homes
headline.print_headline: Obama Moves to Ease Path for Ex-Prisoners Seeking Jobs at Federal Agencies
